page.title: 10Lord Pembroke of Wilton
page.content: Lord Pembroke is the 17th Earl and he inherited the title and the Wilton Estates in 1969. At the age of 8 he went to school near Wokenham then went on to Eton College and Christchurch, Oxford where he studied history. He did not like school. As a child his favourite hobby was ornithology. Lord Pembroke now follows a career as a film editor. He has been interested in films since he was 20. He started his career in 1965. The films which he edited and likes most are "The Life of Oscar Wilde" and "What Colour is the Wind". He has also done a lot of work for television. He likes both classical and pop music. His favourite pop stars are Bruce Springstein, Duran Duran and The Police.
